poem:
**Death Matrix**

Puff upon puff, 
the years escape — 

nicotine fogged 
windows clouding 
the ticking moment;

outside the pub, 
calculations of when 
I might cease 
to stand here — 

luring, that one clear 
night, a flickering 
glimpse of breath, 
life and death 

tabulating in the smoke.
